Due to differences among countries in history, culture, institution and level of development, their peoples have different understandings of democracy and various methods of achieving it. It is the people‚Äôs legitimate right to choose their own road and decide how to make it.

When we witness the word ‚Äúdemocracy‚Äù and ‚Äúhuman rights‚Äù have been frequently manipulated by a few countries to exercise interference and hegemony, disturbing and disordering the world, a question mark comes to our mind: 
What is a true democracy? 
How can it be achieved?

Ambassador Qi Zhenhong:

Democracy is not Coca-Cola produced with one formula and tasted exactly alike. They're flowers blooming, all beautiful but different with own features.

Sri Lanka is the oldest democracy in Asia, while China follows the ‚Äúwhole-process people‚Äôs democracy‚Äù. https://t.co/gueExf90Ac

Judgement on whether a country is a democracy should be made by their people, not by a handful of others. In the international fora, it should be judged together by the international community, not by a self-righteous minority ‚Äúlecturer of democracy‚Äù.

Democracy is not an ornament only for decoration, but a way to solve people's problems. A democracy or not depends on whether its people are the masters of the country. If the people are awakened only for voting but have no say after election, it is not a true democracy.

Amb. Qi:
Democracy is universal, but also specific. It has been
developed down the ages, but also evolves in a developing real world. In fact, to examine the rich and diverse democratic institutions and practices of humanity from a monotonous perspective itself is undemocratic. https://t.co/lUBLXsgEzy

But overall, RCEP is a great thing. It finally creates an integrated Indo-Pacific trade bloc, will support COVID recovery, and shows the region's commitment to economic openness and integration at a time of global closure and protectionism. Chapeau to the Indo-Pacific! /FIN

Of course, there is a large "India shaped hole". India was supposed to be a member, but in 2019 withdrew due to trade and political concerns with the PRC. Unfortunately, this will perpetuate India's longstanding economic exclusion from the region. /11 https://t.co/oIre6pN2Ds

RCEP will also redraw the strategic map of the region. By encouraging within-region value chains to form, economies will become more closely knit-together, and by corollary less dependent on external partners. /9 https://t.co/c4uhr7snR1

RCEP is therefore critical for the region's post COVID recovery. Indo-Pacific economies rely heavily on their integration through value chains, and by unlocking new opportunities RCEP will turbo-charge economic recovery efforts in 2022. /8 https://t.co/lVjwY1PIEa

And its not just certficates of origin. RCEP includes a huge range of regulatory harmonisations, across standards, services, digital, investment and others. This allows regional value chains to seamlessly operate across the entire RCEP bloc. /7

Rules-of-origin illustrate how this work. At present, products in value chains need to get a different "origin certificate" for every node they pass through. But under RCEP, they can pass through multiple stages using a "Made in RCEP" certificate. / 6 https://t.co/tOWZEFmn3C

As a result, some dismiss RCEP as being a "low ambition" FTA, because it only makes small cuts to tariffs. But this critique misses the point. The real gains from RCEP come from linking together previous agreements to accelerate the growth of regional value chains. /5

What does it do? RCEP is unique because it is a "harmonisation agreement". It takes the existing network of FTAs between ASEAN and its five "Plus One" partners, and knits them together in a single agreement. Its aim is integration, not new trade liberalisation. /4

Where did it come from? The need for a "ASEAN Plus" trade bloc was first recognised following the Asian Financial Crisis way back in 1998! But it took a decade to start negotiations, and another decade to finish them. The region finally now has an integrated trade bloc /3

First, what is RCEP? Its an Indo-Pacific trade bloc comprised of the 10 ASEAN economies, plus Jpn, RoK, PRC, Aus and NZ. By GDP and population it will be the world's largest trade bloc - edging the EU from top spot - and second in the trade system only to the WTO itself. /2

#RCEP finally becomes reality. With quorum now completing ratification, the world's largest regional trade bloc will enter into force in Jan 2022. RCEP is a landmark agreement that will fundamentally transform the economic and strategic future of the Indo-Pacific. An explainer /1 https://t.co/GFefiC9OnK

There is also a persistent myth that RCEP is an "China-led" agreement, and will lock in PRC economic dominance of the region. But the reality is its ASEAN-led, and will actually open new trade options for the region beyond a dependence on the PRC. /10 https://t.co/EJfPfTpvtR
